document.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

18FD5F18C80549C4B5D7A732BB501433.description:
Select the appropriate visualization based on context and audience and create it using
technology tools to effectively communicate an idea.

66007907ED3F4814B7E16A676A333918.description:
Select and apply features of technology tools effectively to organize, summarize and gain
insight from data.

4F7D1A8A09064784A7C423DD40B9870F.description: Utilize coding to store and extract data more effectively for data analysis.

EBB454056D364AD4B67644DBBEB48DF9.description:
Utilize specific functions in technology tools to perform descriptive and inferential statistical
analysis.

359FDF744FA44499AA5D87B29F8EE015.description:
Select and utilize technology tools to effectively generate conventional and unconventional
visualizations of data to explore patterns and/or analyze a large data set.

7F41A0C725294BF7A41A558745F982DC.description:
The student will be able to select and utilize appropriate technological tools and
functions within those tools to analyze and communicate data effectively.

0BC34019E6BC475BADD75A13A8C3759F.description: Utilize tools to format and store the data appropriately to allow for effective analysis.

231F3B12329B466F8A28D122B5499142.description: optimizing storage of data based on volume, velocity, and variety.

11C4EB93E17341C4AAADB8DEE96B9202.description: merging multiple data sets for efficiency purposes; and

108D1F039CFB42BA950A2FD9062FF649.description: Utilize tools and their functions to combine and store data by:

F114C0101C8B495291DA67E0AE9CD03F.description: standardizing data to conform to contextual norms (e.g., privacy, sensitive data).

B20BDE8009084CD6B1BA10B10EC71C2C.description: removing extraneous data or outliers; and

CD53000B5BED4BFA850FC5C4EC65D78C.description: removing data that are incomplete, incorrect, or duplicated;

CC151751CBDA4337B207C5D426128C30.description: Utilize tools and their functions to clean and validate data by:

37968F8312124E3EB191548C30C7B647.description:
Define the (tools and technological) process to optimally ingest data and to export data after
processing.

1C96193E9DFE431F9CF8F6F873F5BD51.description:
Utilize tools and functions (in tools) to effectively explore the data for issues and errors before
beginning to process it.

2F4DC028A24446D4B89F1C06BF440851.description:
Utilize technology tools to be able to access data effectively from multiple sources (e.g.,
tables, column separated values, spreadsheets, documents, databases).

B042CD298A414A389C6F8DF7B05E0F98.description:
The student will be able to select and utilize appropriate technological tools and
functions within those tools to process and prepare data for analysis.

FF4470E62F174626A152C8E449D46D3F.description:
Select an appropriate statistical distribution and test its goodness of fit based on the context of
the data being analyzed. Statistical distributions may include, but are not limited to

382DC1CB67C1472D8F216BA9A6A3A79C.description: Select pairs of variables that identify meaningful clusters of data.

2DE7EBC9554D457E8A449E8705AD528C.description: Fit nonlinear models to data sets and use these models to predict unobserved data values.

93C4F6BB5CF948B39CD0C8DA80013CF9.description:
Describe the normal curve determined by the mean and standard deviation of a univariate data
set.

2A450A4D89F74695BE187B44E852B16F.description:
Calculate the theoretical probability of random events and compare them to the observed
frequencies.

BB3F41AF044643DB99D2A01C7B5B6DC7.description:
The student will select statistical models and use goodness of fit testing to extract
actionable knowledge directly from data.

6AF43AE968AF412386BDE4FEDE774416.description:
Interpret various emerging visualizations by describing patterns, trends, and relationships
between and among the variables.

7501AD45B2E549E69A0604291C20C218.description:
a bubble chart, which is a multivariate graph that is both a scatterplot and a proportional
area chart. Typically, each plotted point then represents a third variable by the area of its
circle.

A8C440FA35CB4625A6F77311F549E0DB.description: a heat map, which uses color to show changes and magnitude of a third variable to a twodimensional plot; and

69104F0834254F6F8F1348331FE29246.description:
Define emerging visualizations and describe summarization of characteristics and
relationships based on audience and purpose which may include:

9F4C7A7473FE461A9E57E5292505FA81.description:
Apply descriptive statistics to explain measures of central tendency and measures of
variability/dispersion to describe center and spread in visualizations of distributions.

60B308548CF144BF87CB48AAFBF27096.description:
The student will be able to summarize and interpret data represented in both
conventional and emerging visualizations.

A4883501515243C3B2448EB0C0EEA909.description:
Select the optimal model for a data set from among a large collection of models, using
technological tools.

831C8EE751C64C0393533CCD4D304238.description: Recognize the potential implications of removing features.

A82744FE234D4C399B1B335D31C26DD3.description: Use regression techniques to perform selection of optimal features.

8EB3FCA785FF482A834A82A7BE2ECD2A.description:
Identify models that are overly complex and therefore fitting to random noise which decreases
their predictive accuracy.

FA289A7310D04AA7A2E497E8648D0B66.description: Distinguish between linear and nonlinear associations between variables using visualizations.

B968D1BCEEED41EA87EABC7F1E37FA2C.description:
Fit models based on the behavior of the data, (e.g., models of univariate and bivariate data), in
order to make predictions.

8C0E552FA04649C5A275EA082D885C31.description:
Identify factors that contribute to the overall behavior of a data set (e.g., true values, bias, and
noise).

1AF127E8A5DC425AB784F645684B1ECC.description:
The student will select and analyze data models to make predictions, while assessing
accuracy and sources of uncertainty.

F56AB40340774C1EB65362A399A3804A.description: connecting data with existing contextual data.

09D5487C3CB942A59E9A5BDD52E1AE16.description: making data more easily understood by a wider audience; and

CE4A3725AEEA443BA6132515C8028B40.description:
Define and document the process of ingesting, formatting, and cleaning data for future
decision making by:

2C98B68015E748789D38229038C8307F.description:
Identify important parameters about a big data set based on the context of data
collected/acquired.

1AF2FB5262AC42CE910DE372985F82A8.description: Read data from different sources for preparation and analysis.

080C4770D271425AAA879AE104FFBE2F.description: format and enrich the data; and

29F56853F14649C7A0DDF34D61667E79.description: wrangle the data (sort, select, filter, and replace);

AADA3E235CE946A9A7DDF09E1CB64DE4.description: Apply matrix operations using algebraic methods (with the support of technology tools) to:

585A0E43C7044EDAA5A459546565BDCA.description: Explain the pros and cons of collecting data versus acquiring it from existing sources.

FEEF58CFA83B474EA8C1B5C8BFD8EC27.description: The student will be able to acquire and prepare big data sets for modeling and analysis.

905EFAED676347F29FEFFA6740683161.description:
Describe the difference between reliability of a data source compared to statistical reliability
and validity in research analysis. Assess processing source data for reliability based on
validity, completeness, and uniqueness.

BB61D5402C124BC6AC7EDC8A3EC75D77.description:
Explain why determining the reliability of big data sources is a key skill that data scientists
use to build data trust across an organization.

6FD9C1686382439B9A8A2C7F17A95404.description:
The student will be able to assess reliability of source data in preparation for
mathematical modeling.

5BF6372C01764CC1AAD53CCF28095D4B.description:
Justify design choices (based on data set type, size, context, and audience) of data
visualizations to highlight important features, trends, and insights.

F99B38D1833D4870BF7CCB6A692B4C09.description:
Compare two or more different representations to ensure the design communicates the
features and behavior of data sets.

5B94857566654D74B90C7554B4E925AF.description:
Create a visualization of a data set and summarize the representation using the context of the
data.

BDFE088D99BE4EBD8FC301060117D143.description:
Determine the effectiveness of different data visualization choices based on the data context
from conventional statistical charts to unconventional/emerging data visualizations to more
complex visualizations.

006DFEC252C440CF94879C1CB483B1EF.description:
Formulate questions from exploration of a data set to consider how data will communicate a
story.

D044F53CCAE14ED292C012027E9F2250.description: Conduct exploratory data analysis using visualization.

D0272B54F711442C853D632328921941.description:
The student will justify the design, use, and effectiveness of different forms of data
visualizations.

91D5BA1A057B44F0B8B8EB0A7694F291.description:
Explain how data storytelling should include complete and accurate information, and
consistent visuals for effective communication.

013D1D3872994754BA5B6AC78BE76296.description:
Effectively form a narrative based on data available to provide context, insight, and
interpretation to make the analysis more relevant to a given audience.

176AA8494FCF40F9A4412076856B1E11.description:
Effectively simplify the information presented to make it more concise and focus the
audience's attention on the key parameters that support the student’s hypothesis.

2FCE121867BC49DFA403D2402E061DED.description:
Effectively select visualizations that simplify the information, highlight the most important
data, and communicate key points quickly.

2C8DA0F909E04B7F8B073CEA4E9E3FB7.description:
Effectively identify a story worth telling based on the data (looking for trends, correlations,
outliers) and by asking a question or forming a hypothesis based on insight and audience.

AEE869FE727A411FB89DF25E326B864E.description: Explain the steps involved in data storytelling and how it relates to the data cycle.

2B844D38DC524DF89757A0B261363DA1.description:
Define storytelling and explain the importance of storytelling as a strategy to communicate
the idea behind and results of a data science project effectively.

D4F5C6DC79544B44AC73A77B3BAB0173.description: The student will use storytelling as a strategy to effectively communicate with data.

893CC04D82724B9787E6CAE489E26CE0.description: Describe privacy considerations in the collection of data as both a consumer and producer.

88585F7DE75F4A48BD35925560EE1E41.description:
Describe how the data collection process should be focused, relevant, and limited to the scope
of the data project plan.

C58D787CD94747FDB896EB6394103126.description: Identify and describe data biases as a producer as well as a consumer/decision maker of data.

5FC2533448E7400C9E18133F44C5CE44.description: Provide examples of sampling biases in terms of data collection and the potential effects.

E24C4AFB07A8444186E57DCB12E9043F.description:
Identify data biases in the data collection process that include, but are not limited to,
confirmation, selection, outliers, overfitting / under fitting, and confounding and describe
mitigation strategies for these biases.

CFB08298A42940A98D5181A188EDD5B7.description:
The student will be able to identify data biases in the data collection process and
understand the implications and privacy issues surrounding data collection and
processing.

8A0E145A936648F88A4DC92E9558C5BD.description:
Describe the types of data that business, industry, and government entities collect and possible
ways the data is used.

0082BD9C8B2D420688D10A786B7E6DE4.description:
Identify privacy and consumer protection issues that might be a result of how data is
presented.

2F044CA2D5BA4917A456C4EC8F93365C.description:
Identify potential data biases in terms of data presented and discuss the potential effects of
such biases in terms of how they could affect data analysis and decision making.

D1A6A21A4B804F3883F076277CE6032B.description:
Effectively read data summaries and visualizations and explain/translate into nontechnical
terms in proper context.

C90D34B2A3CE4E948561F51300CD0779.description:
Formulate relevant/clarifying questions to identify potential data biases presented in existing
analyses/visualizations.

DDEC88F435B24A27890868762AE86D24.description:
The student will recognize the importance of data literacy and develop an awareness of
how the analysis of data can be used in problem solving to effect change and create
innovative solutions.

6AD8357D18044E9395B6A5EB487BA86E.description:
Given the context and parameters of a problem, choose from among various sampling
techniques, which may include

A8B9FCC7168D4AB08A746D010BA4D61A.description: bias considerations for the sampling process of the project; and

3CF79BFD8BCD435AB48122A308CA41C7.description: resource needs and tools for the project;

A7CABCEE540148FEAE96616A8C0C7349.description: Key Performance Indicators (KPI) for the successful data project deliverables;

1DFA440F5C974FCD9395B71D627C7884.description: a timeline for the project with deliverables;

8DB379C722EA4A5989CAE95B45AB4D62.description: identification of the various parameters of the problem and stakeholders;

AB51BCD31DF7430D83C0E30C8ADFB896.description: definition of the goal of the project as it pertains to a real-world problem;

B63BA160A5CC4F3EB32FCBABA1E1A841.description:
Design a data project plan, which is aligned with the data science cycle, that includes the
following components:

1E3F394EA386411897210CC4DFA20E40.description:
The student will be able to formulate a top-down plan for data collection and analysis,
with quantifiable results, based on the context of a problem.

497F7942EF294385A1A10CA6D6057193.description: Identify and explain constraints of the data-driven approach.

CC49865929DE43D39050EEF4DCBFB0F8.description: Define the stages of the data cycle and how each stage is related to the other.

01E7BF17039D4A1AAECC11B1091AE7BA.description: Create a hypothesis of interest in terms of measurable data.

391B2CE5302542DCBE7AF17E91CA24FF.description: Define relationships between variables and constant relationships.

4F0CF4A635D94126AA45930BACB2335B.description: Understand the type of data relevant to the context of the question at hand.

707F78A08C884C0EA59B863805DF30BE.description:
Identify and explain characteristics that best lend themselves to a data driven approach to
problem solving.

020CDBEF9A96444F9D57DBF19F4D87AC.description:
The student will identify specific examples of real-world problems that can be effectively
addressed using data science.
